intro: Oxytropis sitaipaiensis var. sitaipaiensis, commonly known as the Sitaipai oxytropis, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or steppe environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
